question: As of November 2019, who has become the longest serving Prime Minister of Japan?
explanation: Prime Minister Abe Shinzo became the longest-serving prime minister in the history of Japanâ€™s constitutional government as on November 20, 2019. He has served 2,887 days so far. He surpassed the previous record held by Katsura Taro with a total of 2,886 days in office. The top four longest-serving prime ministers of Japan are Abe Shinzo, Katsura Taro, Sato Eisaku, and Ito Hirobumi.
